    • Method Detail

      • signOutputRaw

        public void signOutputRaw(SignerOuterClass.SignReq request,
                          io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<SignerOuterClass.SignResp> responseObserver)
        
SignOutputRaw is a method that can be used to generated a signature for a
set of inputs/outputs to a transaction. Each request specifies details
concerning how the outputs should be signed, which keys they should be
signed with, and also any optional tweaks. The return value is a fixed
64-byte signature (the same format as we use on the wire in Lightning).
If we are  unable to sign using the specified keys, then an error will be
returned.

      • computeInputScript

        public void computeInputScript(SignerOuterClass.SignReq request,
                               io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<SignerOuterClass.InputScriptResp> responseObserver)
        
ComputeInputScript generates a complete InputIndex for the passed
transaction with the signature as defined within the passed SignDescriptor.
This method should be capable of generating the proper input script for
both regular p2wkh output and p2wkh outputs nested within a regular p2sh
output.
Note that when using this method to sign inputs belonging to the wallet,
the only items of the SignDescriptor that need to be populated are pkScript
in the TxOut field, the value in that same field, and finally the input
index.

      • bindService

        public final io.grpc.ServerServiceDefinition bindService()
